Dead.synopsis: A speak with dead dialogue with Sazza, the captured goblin at the grove.
Dead.how_to_trigger: Start gamein reCon: teleport S_DEN_CapturedGoblinctrl k the cage door sazza is inctrl k sazza to kill herCast speak with dead on corpse

AD_Guards.synopsis: Several conditions of conversations between Arka and Memnos here: Sazza escaped, sazza was killed, the pair wait for the goblin attack at the gates, or Arka's brother, Kanon, has been killed by goblins.

Friend.synopsis: Memnos - the supporting optional tiefling character in the Captive Goblin situation, Friend to Arka.
Friend.how_to_trigger: repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 209.42, 26.38, 407.204. trigger attack on DEN5. in recon "killcombat"6. goto 208.41, 35.46, 446.977. Talk with Memnos8. if you get DEN_CapturedGoblin_GuardsGrieve then Talk to Memnos again

GuardsAvenge.synopsis: The grieving tiefling pair at the gate face off with Sazza. Arka is set on killing Sazza as indirect revenge for the death of Kanon, who was slain by goblins.
GuardsAvenge.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. loadlevel Wild_Main_A2. Goto 209, 429 to trigger Plea At The Gates3. Skip through dialogue4. Killcombat to finish the combat5. Find Kanon's body on top of the gate6. Talk to Arka or Memnos, who are standing over him and skip through7.Arka (and Memnos if alive) will goto Sazza's cage at 186, 598, wait for them to arrive.8. Walk over to cage.

Caged.synopsis: Character is caged for this entire dialogue If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp.

GuardsGrieve.synopsis:
Not critpath. Covers the grieving tiefling pair at the gate and their faceoff with the Captive Goblin. 

At the start of N1196, Arka is aiming a crossbow at Sazza the goblin. The player can step into the path of the shot and convince her not to kill the goblin.
GuardsGrieve.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel Wild_Main_A3. Goto 209, 429 to trigger Plea At The Gates4. Skip through dialogue5. Killcombat to finish the combat6. Find Kanon's body on top of the gate7. Talk to Arka or Memnos, who are standing over him

PAD_Shot.synopsis: Arka has just killed Sazza with her crossbow. Reaction of the party.Requires 2 characters.Speaker 1 is the character who let Arka do the deed through the dialog, as such their reply should keep that in mind.Speaker 2 is a nearby companion who instigates the PAD and can have an opinionated line.

GuardsIdle.synopsis: Arka and Memnos are idle in the druid grove after going to confront the captive goblin Sazza. The goblin may or may not have been killed in this prior scene. Arka remains bitter over the recent death of their friend, Kagha, while Memnos, if present, tries to shake her out of it.
GuardsIdle.how_to_trigger: load WLD_Main_Aoe Denraiddonegoto 203.57; 36.686; 441.315 , talk to arka.goto 187.8; 21.781; 599.34, wait for captured goblins to trigger.   choose the option to stand between them and end the cinematic. Speak to Arka as she is walking away .

individual_metadata.synopsis:
If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp. Note from Swen on this dialogue: ''I also want a different emotion in there. This goblin is negotiating with me. Think a terrorist that is locked up and who is offering their interrogators an option to save their lives if they free her.
It'll be quite the intense conversation.''
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 184 5974. Brake cage door with ctrl K5. speak to goblin

AD_TieflingLeader.synopsis: Conversation between Zevlor and Sazza that the player can overhear. The idea is that the player will understand there's something weird going on with Zevlor, that he isn't all he seems, without giving away the whole shebang.

PAD_Healer.synopsis: Played after being told by Sazza about Gut.Speaker 1 is the character who left the dialog. Neutral inquisitive remark about whether the rumoured healer could really help.Speaker 2 is any other party member. Line can be opinionated.

Transit.synopsis: The grieving tiefling pair moves to Sazza. Arka is set on killing Sazza as indirect revenge for the death of Kanon, who was slain by goblins.

AD.synopsis: Sazza's ADs when she's in the druid grove. She's in a cage for most of these, or could have been broken out by the player. She's at risk of life and limb but that doesn't stop her from antagonizing everyone around her.

PAD_Freed.synopsis: This VB plays after Sazza was escorted outside of the Grove.The dialog may play with one or two speakers.Speaker 1 is the character who helped her escape.Speaker 2 is an accompanying party member, and as such may have an opinion on the issue.
PAD_Freed.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. recruit any 3 companions4. use debugbook to change the companions to avatars5. oe denraiddone6. goto 203, 27, 5517. resolve grieving tiefling,8. goto 185, 21, 5989. Let cinematic play out and pick 'Step in between them'10. speak to Sazza and press 1 continuously as option until scene ends

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Based on the synopses and trigger notes, we can infer that some sessions clearly belong to branches that depend on earlier events. One branch concerns the captive goblin: if the player saves the captive (triggering the caged dialogue), then later Sazza is escorted outside of the grove, which leads to the PAD_Freed dialogue. This creates an ordering: the captive (Caged) event must come before the rescue (PAD_Freed) outcome. In a different branch—the gate confrontation—the events are triggered by Kanon’s death. In that branch the dialogue AD_Guards is triggered (with conditions like whether Sazza escaped, was killed, or if Kanon is dead). When Kanon is dead the tiefling pair (Arka and Memnos) set out for revenge. One possibility is that they are determined to avenge Kanon – this leads to a sequence where AD_Guards is followed by a confrontation (here labeled as GuardsAvenge) that, if left unchecked, results in Arka killing Sazza with her crossbow (PAD_Shot). In the PAD_Shot branch the corpse is later used in a ‘speak with dead’ dialogue (Dead) and afterward the pair are seen idling in the grove (GuardsIdle). Alternatively, if the player intervenes when Arka is about to fire, a different dialogue (GuardsGrieve) is triggered instead. In that situation, Memnos then re‐engages in conversation (Friend) and eventually the pair also idle (GuardsIdle). Thus, PAD_Shot (with its follow‐up Dead) and GuardsGrieve (with its follow‐up Friend) are mutually exclusive outcomes of the critical moment. Also, rescuing Sazza (eventually leading to PAD_Freed) is mutually exclusive with her being killed (in which case PAD_Shot and Dead come into play). Other sessions (AD_TieflingLeader, AD, PAD_Healer, and the unnamed duplicate of “Caged”) do not have explicit ordering or branch restrictions so they are omitted from this ordering/exclusivity summary.

Dead_1.speaker: Narrator
Dead_1.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_21.speaker: Sazza
Dead_21.context: NodeContext: cold, emotionless, speaking with her corpse

Dead_17.speaker: Sazza
Dead_17.context: NodeContext: cold, emotionless, speaking with her corpse

Dead_24.speaker: Sazza
Dead_24.context: NodeContext: cold, emotionless, speaking with her corpse

Dead_10.speaker: Player
Dead_10.text: Can anyone in your tribe heal?

Dead_11.speaker: Sazza
Dead_11.context: NodeContext: cold, emotionless, speaking with her corpse

Dead_13.speaker: Player
Dead_13.text: Where can I find this priestess Gut?

Dead_5.speaker: Sazza
Dead_5.context: NodeContext: cold, emotionless, speaking with her corpse

Dead_0.speaker: Player
Dead_0.text: Who or what is the Absolute?

Dead_2.speaker: Sazza
Dead_2.context: NodeContext: cold, emotionless, speaking with her corpse

Dead_15.speaker: Player
Dead_15.text: Your tribe must have some valuable loot. Where do they hide it?

Dead_25.speaker: Sazza
Dead_25.context: NodeContext: cold, emotionless, speaking with her corpse

Dead_6.speaker: Narrator
Dead_6.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

AD_Guards_3.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_3.text: I wonder when the goblins will come.

AD_Guards_11.speaker: Memnos
AD_Guards_11.text: You say that like you're looking forward to it.

AD_Guards_26.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_26.text: I could use the target practice.

AD_Guards_5.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_5.text: Someone got to her first. Damn it.
AD_Guards_5.context: NodeContext:  Reacting to the fact that her target, Sazza, is already dead

AD_Guards_8.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_8.context: NodeContext: Wants to kill a captive goblin to avenge her dead friend

AD_Guards_0.speaker: Memnos
AD_Guards_0.context: NodeContext: Memnos tries to reason with Arka - the goblin isn't worth it.

AD_Guards_1.speaker: Sazza
AD_Guards_1.text: Stop talking an' shoot me. If you even can.

AD_Guards_13.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_13.text: Feels like we're all waiting to die.

AD_Guards_14.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_14.text: I wonder when the goblins will come.
AD_Guards_14.context: NodeContext: Waiting for the next goblin attack

AD_Guards_20.speaker: Memnos
AD_Guards_20.text: You say that like you're looking forward to it.

AD_Guards_18.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_18.text: Absolutely. I could use the target practice.

AD_Guards_7.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_7.text: I could use some target practice.

AD_Guards_23.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_23.text: Don't do this to me, Kanon.

AD_Guards_17.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_17.context: NodeContext: Cold. She's just killed a captive goblin to avenge her friend

AD_Guards_24.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_24.text: Shame the goblins didn't kill me too.

AD_Guards_27.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_27.text: Someone's going to answer for this.

AD_Guards_21.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_21.context: NodeContext: Sets off towards the target of her revenge.

AD_Guards_29.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_29.text: She... she got away. Gods damn it!
AD_Guards_29.context: NodeContext:  Reacting to the fact that her target, Sazza, is already gone

AD_Guards_22.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards_22.text: I'll find you. Count on it.

Friend_0.speaker: Memnos
Friend_0.text: So much death. So much waste.
Friend_0.context: NodeContext: Arka is dead. Cold grief - not falling apart, but trying to keep it together.

Friend_2.speaker: Memnos
Friend_2.text: Can't talk now. Arka needs me.

Friend_3.speaker: Memnos
Friend_3.text: Heard you killed the goblin boss. I hope this gives Arka some measure of peace.

GuardsAvenge_6.speaker: Memnos
GuardsAvenge_6.text: Arka, wait! You can't just shoot her!

GuardsAvenge_100.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_100.text: Why not? That's what her kind did to Kanon.

GuardsAvenge_11.speaker: Sazza
GuardsAvenge_11.text: Ya ain't gonna shoot me. Yer hands are shakin'.
GuardsAvenge_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: CUSTOM SCENE VIEWER: Sazza in cageNodeContext: mocking. Sazza is mocking Arka. Arka's hands ARE shaking and so is the crossbow.

GuardsAvenge_49.speaker: Sazza
GuardsAvenge_49.text: Ya ain't gonna shoot me. Yer hands are shakin'.
GuardsAvenge_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: CUSTOM SCENE VIEWER: Sazza in cageNodeContext: mocking. Sazza is mocking Arka. Arka's hands ARE shaking and so is the crossbow.

GuardsAvenge_64.speaker: Memnos
GuardsAvenge_64.text: Put it down. She can't fight back.

GuardsAvenge_70.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_70.text: That's the point. Get out of the way.

GuardsAvenge_41.speaker: Memnos
GuardsAvenge_41.text: She didn't kill your brother, Arka. You're better than this.
GuardsAvenge_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: SCRIPT: Stepping otu of the way. NodeContext: Sadly

GuardsAvenge_38.speaker: Narrator
GuardsAvenge_38.text: *Your mind wanders: If the crossbow bolt shot through her mouth, would she taste the metal before she died?*

GuardsAvenge_28.speaker: Sazza
GuardsAvenge_28.text: Shoot before you lose your nerve, tiefling. If you ever had it to begin with.

GuardsAvenge_52.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_52.text: Shut up. Those words could be your last.

GuardsAvenge_74.speaker: Sazza
GuardsAvenge_74.text: I'm not afraid. Chosen by the Absolute, I am. I'm blessed.

GuardsAvenge_93.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_93.text: Oh, I'll bless you all right.
GuardsAvenge_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aiming crossbow.NodeContext: grim and snappy

GuardsAvenge_68.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_68.text: Move in front of the tiefling's crossbow.
GuardsAvenge_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: SCRIPT: Player steps into the path of the shot, protecting Sazza.

GuardsAvenge_95.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_95.text: Step between the crossbow and the goblin.
GuardsAvenge_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: SCRIPT: Player steps into the path of the shot, protecting Sazza.

GuardsAvenge_23.speaker: Sazza
GuardsAvenge_23.text: Looks like the Absolute sent me a protector. Ya gonna kill them too?
GuardsAvenge_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sazza in cageNodeContext: Laughs

GuardsAvenge_13.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: to goblin, then to playerNodeContext: to goblin, then to player

GuardsAvenge_21.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_21.text: What would Kanon think of you now?

GuardsAvenge_22.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_22.context: NodeContext: The player's convinced her to spare the goblin, but she's lashing out in grief.

GuardsAvenge_78.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_78.text: Lower the crossbow, or I'll deliver you right to your brother.

GuardsAvenge_56.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_56.text: No, shoot me. Should be easy, right?

GuardsAvenge_42.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_42.text: What in every hell is wrong with you?
GuardsAvenge_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astonished horror - this player is crazy!NodeContext: Astonished horror

GuardsAvenge_44.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_44.text: You fought for us, so I'll give you one last chance. Move.

GuardsAvenge_89.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_89.text: This won't avenge Kanon. It won't change anything.

GuardsAvenge_15.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_15.text: You're right. I wish you weren't, I really do.

GuardsAvenge_69.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Beat before speaking, studying the player to see if they're serious. NodeContext: First sentence quiet. Second one loud/.

GuardsAvenge_106.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_106.text: I sense the pain you carry - but killing this creature will not ease your burden.

GuardsAvenge_81.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_81.text: Maybe not. But it'll wipe the shit-grin off its face, at least.

GuardsAvenge_107.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_107.text: You want to die for this stupid goblin? Fine.

GuardsAvenge_67.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_67.text: Killing this goblin won't help you. Let the gods provide comfort.

GuardsAvenge_30.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_30.text: Comfort? Is that what you think I'm after?

GuardsAvenge_10.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_10.text: Why do you care if a goblin lives or dies?

GuardsAvenge_47.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_47.text: Because she's not a practice target. She's a person.

GuardsAvenge_82.speaker: Lae'zel
GuardsAvenge_82.text: Tsk. Your soft heart will be the death of us.

GuardsAvenge_24.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_24.text: Can't say I understand that. Not sure I want to.

GuardsAvenge_19.speaker: Memnos
GuardsAvenge_19.text: It's all right, Arka. Let's go.
GuardsAvenge_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Comforting Arka. NodeContext: Softly, comforting

GuardsAvenge_84.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_84.text: If she dies, she'll take everything she knows to the grave.

GuardsAvenge_8.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_8.text: If you believe anything the beast tells you, you're an idiot.

GuardsAvenge_54.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_54.text: A goblin prisoner. Her life isn't yours to take.

GuardsAvenge_80.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_80.text: Not sure I get that. The bars don't make her special. But, fine, whatever.

GuardsAvenge_31.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_31.text: Because vengeance eats people alive. You'll grant the goblins two victories this day.

GuardsAvenge_46.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angrily, then calming herself down.NodeContext: Hotly, then giving up.

GuardsAvenge_25.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_25.text: She still has a story to tell. One I want to hear.

GuardsAvenge_59.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_59.text: I'm not looking for miracles. Just blood.

GuardsAvenge_87.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_87.text: Kanon would hate me for this. But he's not here. They took him from me.
GuardsAvenge_87.context: NodeContext: Emotional. She's wrestling with herself over doing this, but she doesn't know what else to do.

GuardsAvenge_9.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_9.text: Ugh... stop it! Get out of my head!

GuardsAvenge_73.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: SCRIPT: Step out of way

GuardsAvenge_2.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_2.text: Here it comes, you little beast.

GuardsAvenge_5.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_5.text: This- This is wrong, isn't it?

GuardsAvenge_94.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge_94.text: I didn't ask for you to say a damn thing - keep out of it!
GuardsAvenge_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arka aiming a crossbow at SazzaNodeContext: Addressing the player

GuardsAvenge_86.speaker: Player
GuardsAvenge_86.text: This goblin is in need of judgement. I should decide her fate.

GuardsAvenge_3.speaker: Sazza
GuardsAvenge_3.text: Doesn't even matter if ya kill me. I'm chosen by the Absolute, I am. I'm blessed.

Caged_1.speaker: Sazza
Caged_1.text: We're runnin' out of time. They're gonna murder me!

Caged_14.speaker: Sazza
Caged_14.text: Wotcher messin' with my cage for?
Caged_14.context: NodeContext: spoken when player tampers with her cage while she's locked up - curious

Caged_103.speaker: Sazza
Caged_103.text: Didn't expect to see a drow in here. Did the boss lady send you to rescue me?

Caged_80.speaker: Sazza
Caged_80.text: Another drow - she's one of my best mates. Thought you might work for her.

Caged_79.speaker: Sazza
Caged_79.text: You're not mates with the tiefs, are you? You need to get back to your own people before you go soft.

Caged_62.speaker: Sazza
Caged_62.text: The lady that sent me here's the cruellest drow I ever met. You could learn a thing or two from her.

Caged_28.speaker: Sazza
Caged_28.text: Get me outta here, and I'll take you to meet her and the rest of my tribe.

Caged_73.speaker: Player
Caged_73.text: Yes, she sent me. Ready to get out of here?

Caged_33.speaker: Player
Caged_33.text: Yes, she sent me. Ready to get out of here?

Caged_47.speaker: Sazza
Caged_47.text: Yeah. Take me back to the tribe, and we'll tell the boss all about this pretty little place so she can burn it to the ground.

Caged_22.speaker: Sazza
Caged_22.text: We'll be heroes, blessed by Priestess Gut in the name of the Absolute.

Caged_4.speaker: Sazza
Caged_4.text: Don't believe you. You ain't got enough scars to be one of her playthings.

Caged_38.speaker: Sazza
Caged_38.text: Yer a long way from 'ome, ain't ya, underdwarf?

Caged_39.speaker: Sazza
Caged_39.text: Get me outta 'ere, an' I'll introduce you to my tribe. You'd like 'em.

Caged_42.speaker: Player
Caged_42.text: Well, if you make it worth my while...

Caged_99.speaker: Player
Caged_99.text: Goblins belong in cages. You won't be getting my help.

Caged_90.speaker: Sazza
Caged_90.text: Aw, c'mon. We could be mates.

Caged_13.speaker: Player
Caged_13.text: Patience. I'll get you out soon.

Caged_10.speaker: Sazza
Caged_10.text: I been patient. So hurry it up, yeah?

Caged_84.speaker: Player
Caged_84.text: What could a tribe of goblins possibly offer me?

Caged_63.speaker: Sazza
Caged_63.text: The power of the Absolute, of course! Priestess Gut will tell you all about it and make sure you have everything you need.

Caged_16.speaker: Sazza
Caged_16.text: The Absolute is gold from the sky, She is. The blessin' in the storm an' the storm itself.

Caged_87.speaker: Sazza
Caged_87.text: We're burnin' Her name across the face o' the world, we are.

Caged_37.speaker: Player
Caged_37.text: Priestess Gut is quite the name. Tell me more.

Caged_19.speaker: Sazza
Caged_19.text: I already met your friend. You here to get me out of here?

Caged_20.speaker: Sazza
Caged_20.text: Yer a long way from 'ome, ain't ya, underdwarf?

Caged_27.speaker: Sazza
Caged_27.text: You gonna open this cage or wot?

Caged_30.speaker: Sazza
Caged_30.text: Didn't expect to see a drow in here. Did the boss lady send you to rescue me?

Caged_61.speaker: Sazza
Caged_61.text: Ain't sure why ya protected me. Don't care, neither.

Caged_59.speaker: Sazza
Caged_59.text: It's too late to make friends, worgmeat. My tribe's comin'.

Caged_5.speaker: Sazza
Caged_5.text: They're gonna burn this pretty place for the glory of the Absolute and 'ang ya by yer guts.

Caged_2.speaker: Player
Caged_2.text: I just saved your life. Show some gratitude.

Caged_7.speaker: Sazza
Caged_7.text: They'll peel yer face off and nail it to a wall!

Caged_56.speaker: Sazza
Caged_56.text: I ain't scared of some guard. Stick a dozen arrows in me, and Priestess Gut'd still patch me up.

Caged_25.speaker: Player
Caged_25.text: They can try, but they won't be the first goblins I've killed today.

Caged_35.speaker: Sazza
Caged_35.text: We got more than ya can handle. And our priestess keeps us fightin' even if someone sticks a few holes in us.

Caged_92.speaker: Player
Caged_92.text: Who is this Absolute you're so fond of? Your god?

Caged_98.speaker: Sazza
Caged_98.text: They're gonna burn this pretty place for the glory of the Absolute and 'ang ya by yer guts.

Caged_41.speaker: Player
Caged_41.text: Ah, the 'Absolute'. This is the deity you're bowing to?

Caged_0.speaker: Player
Caged_0.text: The Absolute? Can't say I know your god.

Caged_70.speaker: Sazza
Caged_70.text: We're burnin' Her name across the face o' the world, we are.
Caged_70.context: NodeContext: speaking of her god - the Absolute - awe.

Caged_24.speaker: Sazza
Caged_24.text: The Absolute is gold from the sky, She is. The blessin' in the storm an' the storm itself.
Caged_24.context: NodeContext: speaking of her god - the Absolute - awe.

Caged_9.speaker: Player
Caged_9.text: You've caught my interest. Have any holy literature on you?

Caged_75.speaker: Sazza
Caged_75.text: My tribe can tell you everythin' there is to know. Absolute blessed one of our own - Priestess Gut.
Caged_75.context: NodeContext: Very arrogant - extremely pleased that a goblin has been chosen to be blessed

Caged_6.speaker: Sazza
Caged_6.text: Got a whole lab set up. Cooks up potions that fix our lads no matter how much of a beatin' they take.

Caged_82.speaker: Sazza
Caged_82.text: Could probably stick yer head back on if someone woz to chop it off. Mighty booyahg.

Caged_83.speaker: Lae'zel
Caged_83.text: Bah. A clever goblin's like a trustworthy ghaik: a figment of the imagination.

Caged_66.speaker: Shadowheart
Caged_66.text: A goblin healer. We really are desperate, aren't we?

Caged_100.speaker: Karlach
Caged_100.text: I wonder how she feels about trepanning.

Caged_34.speaker: Astarion
Caged_34.text: I'm not saying we should trust a goblin, but she sounds very useful.
Caged_34.context: NodeContext: Half muttered to his companion. Emphasis on 'very'

Caged_86.speaker: Player
Caged_86.text: Well, I'd certainly like to meet her.

Caged_95.speaker: Sazza
Caged_95.text: Get me out of 'ere and I'll tell you where to find 'er. Deal?
Caged_95.context: NodeContext: Thinks she's offering a GREAT deal

Caged_57.speaker: Player
Caged_57.text: Deal. I'll get you out of there.

Caged_85.speaker: Sazza
Caged_85.text: Then hurry up an' do it. My tribe ain't as friendly as I am.

Caged_58.speaker: Player
Caged_58.text: You already told me what I need to know. I'll find the priestess myself.

Caged_52.speaker: Sazza
Caged_52.text: Ha! Even if you did find my tribe, they'd set the worgs on ya.

Caged_32.speaker: Sazza
Caged_32.text: You need me - get me outta here, and I'll tell 'em what a good friend you are.
Caged_32.context: NodeContext: heavy emphasis on 'need' - she's convinced she's winning us over

Caged_43.speaker: Player
Caged_43.text: Not a chance. You can rot in that cage.

Caged_12.speaker: Sazza
Caged_12.text: Suit yerself. Lookin' forward to seein' wot yer innards look like.

Caged_49.speaker: Player
Caged_49.text: Just be patient. I'll break you free soon enough.

Caged_29.speaker: Sazza
Caged_29.text: Well, 'urry up. I got all the time in the world. You don't.

Caged_69.speaker: Player
Caged_69.text: Actions have consequences, Sazza. Maybe use this time in the cage to reflect.

Caged_54.speaker: Player
Caged_54.text: Nice story. Buy it for a copper in a tavern nearby?

Caged_72.speaker: Sazza
Caged_72.text: It's the truth - I swear on your mother's grave.
Caged_72.context: NodeContext: as if swearing a solemn oath

Caged_45.speaker: Wyll
Caged_45.text: I'd sooner swig a flask of acid than anything a goblin cooks up.

Caged_50.speaker: Gale
Caged_50.text: Booyahg - the goblin word for magic. Primitive to a fault, but not entirely without merit.

Caged_77.speaker: Player
Caged_77.text: An all-powerful goddess that can't get you out of a cage?

Caged_18.speaker: Sazza
Caged_18.text: Maybe She sent you to help me. An' ya will, if ya wanna save yer skin.

Caged_68.speaker: Sazza
Caged_68.text: And if the tiefs stick a few arrows in us on the way out of here, don't worry. Priestess Gut'll patch us up.

Caged_64.speaker: Sazza
Caged_64.text: Runnin' out of time, worgmeat. My family'll be 'ere soon. Lemme out.

Caged_71.speaker: Sazza
Caged_71.text: Ain't sure why ya killed that soft-arse to protect me. Don't care, neither.

Caged_97.speaker: Sazza
Caged_97.text: Oh, look - one of ya found the stones to talk to me rather than cryin' an' moanin' about yer dead mates.

Caged_104.speaker: Sazza
Caged_104.text: No point turnin' on yer own if yer just gonna give 'em a little tap.

GuardsGrieve_18.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: CUSTOM SCENE VIEWER: [Around corpse.] Arka kneels by corpse

GuardsGrieve_22.speaker: Memnos
GuardsGrieve_22.text: It's... it's too late. Look at him.

GuardsGrieve_0.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_0.text: You idiot. Don't you do this to me!
GuardsGrieve_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mourning over a dead brother

GuardsGrieve_36.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_36.text: Don't be sorry - fetch some help!

GuardsGrieve_44.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_44.text: He's not breathing. Go find a healer!
GuardsGrieve_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: CUSTOM SCENE VIEWER: [Around corpse.] Arka kneels by corpseNodeContext: Desperately

GuardsGrieve_4.speaker: Lae'zel
GuardsGrieve_4.text: Do not embarrass yourself. He is gone.

GuardsGrieve_28.speaker: Memnos
GuardsGrieve_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking down at the corpse on the ground. NodeContext: Trying to get her to confront the truth,.

GuardsGrieve_53.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Memnos, then to her brother on the ground. NodeContext: Slowly, agonised.

GuardsGrieve_42.speaker: Narrator
GuardsGrieve_42.text: *You shiver at the thought of a radiant future. Goblin and tiefling may reap slaughter upon one another until none remain, if you guide them true.*

GuardsGrieve_12.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_12.text: End every one of those goblins - make them suffer to avenge your fallen friend.

GuardsGrieve_55.speaker: Memnos
GuardsGrieve_55.text: They'll slaughter us if we leave. There's nothing we can do.

GuardsGrieve_31.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arka is kneelingNodeContext: Answering "They'll slaughter us if we leave."

GuardsGrieve_32.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_32.text: Someone's going to pay for this.
GuardsGrieve_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arka stands up. Camera changeNodeContext: Angry satisfaction

GuardsGrieve_34.speaker: Memnos
GuardsGrieve_34.text: Arka, no, wait! What are you doing?

GuardsGrieve_43.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_43.text: You need to avenge this - spill some goblin blood.

GuardsGrieve_48.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_48.text: I'm sorry. It happened so fast.

GuardsGrieve_57.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_57.text: He's dead. Stop wasting your time.

GuardsGrieve_29.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_29.text: I'll say a blessing to guide his soul.

GuardsGrieve_47.speaker: Memnos
GuardsGrieve_47.context: NodeContext: Gently, talking to a mourning friend.

GuardsGrieve_38.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arka is kneelingNodeContext: rising anger

GuardsGrieve_26.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_26.text: He is gone - returned into the cycle. We can only wish him peace in the next life.

GuardsGrieve_20.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_20.text: How can you look at his body and speak to me of peace?

GuardsGrieve_52.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_52.text: Memnos? Where are you? He's not... he's not breathing!
GuardsGrieve_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: CUSTOM SCENE VIEWER: [Around corpse.] Looking around desperately. Arka kneels by corpseNodeContext: Looking around

GuardsGrieve_14.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_14.text: You idiot. Don't you do this to me!
GuardsGrieve_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mourning over a dead brother on the ground.NodeContext: Mourning over a dead brother

GuardsGrieve_54.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_54.text: Kanon is dead. And so is Memnos.

GuardsGrieve_40.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_40.context: NodeContext: Faltering over the word - didn't know someone was dead.

GuardsGrieve_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: |*She looked around the battlefield, moaning at the sight of dead bodies elsewhere, then back to Kanon.*|

GuardsGrieve_51.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_51.text: Your friends are dead - both of them. They need to be avenged.

GuardsGrieve_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Her grief turns to fury. She rises, holding her crossbow.|

GuardsGrieve_3.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_3.text: Someone's going to pay for this.
GuardsGrieve_3.context: NodeContext: Angrier and angrier. Arka stands up

GuardsGrieve_16.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_16.text: A goblin we captured yesterday. I'm going to kill it.

GuardsGrieve_24.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_24.text: Yes. Good. Go forth in hate.

GuardsGrieve_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: SCRIPTING: |She storms back towards the Grove, holding her crossbow.|

GuardsGrieve_15.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_15.text: Place your hand on her shoulder.
GuardsGrieve_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Attemps to put hand on shoulder

GuardsGrieve_56.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_56.text: No. I don't want your godsdamned comfort. I want blood.
GuardsGrieve_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Interaction between the Player and Arka

GuardsGrieve_7.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_7.text: The gods have taken him. All you can do is pray.

GuardsGrieve_39.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_39.text: No. We've prayed enough. We've lost enough.

GuardsGrieve_5.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_5.text: He is gone - returned into the cycle. We can only wish him peace in the next life.

GuardsGrieve_35.speaker: Arka
GuardsGrieve_35.text: Peace? No. The time for peace is over.

GuardsGrieve_37.speaker: Player
GuardsGrieve_37.text: Memnos is gone, too. Don't weep - they died well. Heroically.

PAD_Shot_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Shot_1.text: Sloppily done. But I guess the goblin had it coming.

PAD_Shot_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Shot_0.text: Won't shed tears over a goblin, but still - not a pretty scene.

GuardsIdle_1.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle_1.text: Having fun with your new goblin friend? Bet you aren't.

GuardsIdle_5.speaker: Memnos
GuardsIdle_5.text: Please, leave us be. This isn't a good time -

GuardsIdle_13.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle_13.text: Let's hit the road, Memnos. I'm sick of this place.
GuardsIdle_13.context: NodeContext: Bad memories in this plac

GuardsIdle_16.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle_16.text: I've had some time to think since we last talked. Can't say I'm enjoying it much.
GuardsIdle_16.context: NodeContext: Attempt at wry humor. Recovering from grief.

GuardsIdle_18.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle_18.text: I need some time alone. Please.
GuardsIdle_18.context: NodeContext: Still processing the loss of her friend and her attempt at revenge

GuardsIdle_25.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle_25.text: That goblin won't be the last.

GuardsIdle_12.speaker: Player
GuardsIdle_12.text: It was a nice shot, if nothing else.

GuardsIdle_21.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle_21.text: It was justice. Or the start of it.

GuardsIdle_24.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle_24.context: NodeContext: Processing the fact. In the next line, she'll be resolved to kill more goblins

GuardsIdle_10.speaker: Player
GuardsIdle_10.text: Bit of a fish in a barrel there. You could have given her a fighting chance.

GuardsIdle_6.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle_6.text: Fighting chance? That's more than Kanon got.

GuardsIdle_27.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle_27.text: Heard you killed the goblin king. Did he suffer?

GuardsIdle_11.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle_11.text: Never mind, don't tell me. I want to picture it for myself.

130.speaker: Sazza
130.text: Take this. It's everything I've got. I won't try an' get ya killed again, promise.
130.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sazza handing reward to playerInternalNodeContext: Player gets reward.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Slow down. I have questions for you.

46.speaker: Sazza
46.text: I tell ya anything, and my life ain't worth a rat's breakfast.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Tell me, or you'll be my breakfast.
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: SCRIPT: Player moves toward SazzaNodeContext: Reaching out

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Bad news for me. Good news for the spiders.
142.context: CinematicNodeContext: SCRIPT: Player moves toward SazzaNodeContext: Reaching out

114.speaker: Sazza
114.text: She's got all kinds of booyahg. Sickly tastin' stuff - might make your limbs grow back, but it's as sour as a bugbear's widdle.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: A tribe like yours must have plenty of treasure. Where's it hiding?

110.speaker: Sazza
110.text: I saw Dror Ragzlin stash some stuff behind the waterfall near the bridge.
110.context: NodeContext: scared, trying to make friends

100.speaker: Sazza
100.text: You want it? It's yours! It's all yours!
100.context: NodeContext: scared, trying to make friends

70.speaker: Sazza
70.text: Is that it? Can I go?

93.speaker: Sazza
93.text: An' that's all I know, I swear.

122.speaker: Sazza
122.text: I tell ya anyfing, they'll toss me back in the pit!

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I've saved your hide twice now. You owe me.

71.speaker: Sazza
71.text: Dunno - never repaid anything. But you been square with me, true.

69.speaker: Sazza
69.text: Dunno. I don't repay 'em, as a rule.

17.speaker: Sazza
17.text: I ain't sayin' nuffin' else. They'll kill me an' kill me slow.

124.speaker: Sazza
124.context: InternalNodeContext: Combat starts with Sazza alone.

15.speaker: Sazza
15.text: O' course, I'll prob'ly be a rat's breakfast myself if I don't tell this one something.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: You're in trouble no matter what. You may as well talk.

8.speaker: Sazza
8.text: I guess yer right - I'm worgmeat either way.

0.speaker: Sazza
0.text: What are ya... what are ya doin'?

12.speaker: Sazza
12.text: I won't bother ya any more. I swear.

10.speaker: Sazza
10.text: Ain't sure why ya killed yer own to protect me. Don't care, neither.

141.speaker: Sazza
141.text: It's too late to make friends, worgmeat. My tribe's comin'.

13.speaker: Sazza
13.text: No point turnin' on yer own if yer just gonna give 'em a little tap.
13.context: NodeContext: Mocking - just watched you attack allies to save her but let them live

33.speaker: Sazza
33.text: 'Ello again. Commander's waitin' to meet ya. Don't be shy.

37.speaker: Sazza
37.text: Gonna go tell the commander 'bout you. All nice things, 'course.

44.speaker: Sazza
44.text: Ah, thought I was never gonna get outta there.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sazza stepping out of cage

119.speaker: Sazza
119.text: Good to be free again, gotta say.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Gratitude doesn't help me. Tell me about that priestess.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: You made me a promise, remember?

5.speaker: Sazza
5.text: Never break a promise unless there's somefin' in it for me.

61.speaker: Sazza
61.text: I'll introduce ya to my whole tribe and put in a good word for ya - see ya at the camp.
61.context: NodeContext: slightly menacing; she's going to break her promise

52.speaker: Player
52.text: No one deserves to be locked up like that.

103.speaker: Sazza
103.context: CinematicNodeContext: *She stares at the player like they're insane.*NodeContext: Uncertainly. She thinks they DO.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I'll do a lot worse than that cage if you don't make this worth my while.

53.speaker: Sazza
53.text: Why'd ya open my cage? Think we're gonna be friends?

116.speaker: Sazza
116.text: Too late for that, worgmeat. My tribe's comin'.

29.speaker: Sazza
29.text: They're gonna burn this pretty place for the glory of the Absolute and 'ang ya by yer guts.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I just saved your life. Show some gratitude.

90.speaker: Sazza
90.text: Think my tribe'll care? They'll peel yer face off and nail it to a wall!

38.speaker: Sazza
38.text: Unless... unless ya listen to me. I can save ya.

134.speaker: Sazza
134.text: Help me escape, an' I'll tell my mates to leave ya alone.

155.speaker: Sazza
155.text: Wot do ya say? We 'ave a deal?

147.speaker: Player
147.text: It's a deal, signed and struck.

4.speaker: Sazza
4.text: Then hurry up an' do it. My tribe ain't as friendly as I am.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Follow me. I'll keep you safe.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: They can try, but they won't be the first goblins I've killed today.

109.speaker: Sazza
109.text: We got more than ya can 'andle. We're gonna tear yer gate down an' peel yer skins off.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: This god of yours is new to me.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Don't worry, I'll be gone before the killing starts.

43.speaker: Sazza
43.text: Oh, we like it when people run - makes 'em taste sweeter when ya catch 'em.

84.speaker: Sazza
84.text: Unless... unless ya listen to me. I can save ya.

144.speaker: Sazza
144.text: They're gonna burn this pretty camp for the glory of the Absolute and 'ang ya by yer guts.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Ah, the 'Absolute'. Is this the deity you're bowing to?

87.speaker: Sazza
87.text: We're burnin' Her name across the face o' the world, we are.

77.speaker: Sazza
77.text: The Absolute is gold from the sky, She is. The blessin' in the storm an' the storm itself.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Fascinating. It sounds like nonsense, but I'm intrigued nevertheless.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: With the way things are going, I could use a blessing.

89.speaker: Sazza
89.text: I ain't surprised. Tell you wot.

158.speaker: Sazza
158.text: Help me escape, an' I'll tell my tribe to leave ya alone when they murder this place.

121.speaker: Sazza
121.text: Then you can come to our camp an' learn all about the Absolute. Deal?

32.speaker: Player
32.text: An all-powerful goddess that couldn't get you out of a cage?

96.speaker: Sazza
96.text: Well, maybe She sent ya to 'elp me. An' ya will, if ya wanna save yer skin.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I've never heard of this god of yours.

56.speaker: Sazza
56.text: Yer a long way from home, ain't ya, underdwarf?

136.speaker: Sazza
136.text: Get me outta 'ere, an' I'll introduce you to my tribe. You'd like 'em.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: All right. You've captured my interest.

145.speaker: Sazza
145.text: Priestess Gut will give a little under-dweller like you all the blessings of the Absolute.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: Follow me. I'll keep you safe.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: What could a tribe of goblins possibly offer me?

157.speaker: Sazza
157.text: The power of the Absolute, of course! Priestess Gut will tell you all about Her and get ya branded.

41.speaker: Sazza
41.text: You won't believe what you can do once you've got the blessin' of the Absolute.

63.speaker: Sazza
63.text: I met your friend. Ready to go?

64.speaker: Sazza
64.text: Let me go. I'll sneak off and become a hermit - won't cause trouble for nobody.
64.context: NodeContext: pleading; just survived an attempted execution

66.speaker: Sazza
66.text: Ready to go meet my tribe? Just say the word.

88.speaker: Sazza
88.text: Didn't expect to see a drow in here. Did the boss lady send you to rescue me?

153.speaker: Sazza
153.text: Another drow - she's one of my best mates. Thought you might work for her.

47.speaker: Sazza
47.text: You're not mates with the tiefs, are you? You need to get back to your own people before you go soft.

115.speaker: Sazza
115.text: The lady that sent me here's the cruellest drow I ever met. You could learn a thing or two from her.

24.speaker: Sazza
24.text: Get me outta here, and I'll take you to meet her and the rest of my tribe.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: If she's as cruel as you say, she'll crush your tribe under her heel.

65.speaker: Sazza
65.text: Things are changin'. The Absolute's bringin' us all together - goblins, drow, duergar, gnolls.

111.speaker: Sazza
111.text: Take me home, and Priestess Gut will brand you so you can join the tribe as well.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I've made some strange alliances, but... is she really your 'mate'?

120.speaker: Player
120.text: No drow would sully themselves in a goblin tribe. That's madness.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Yes, she sent me. Ready to get out of here?

45.speaker: Sazza
45.text: Yeah. Take me back to the tribe, and we'll tell the boss all about this pretty little place so she can burn it to the ground.

31.speaker: Sazza
31.text: We'll be heroes, blessed by Priestess Gut in the name of the Absolute.

76.speaker: Sazza
76.text: Don't believe you. There's something a bit soft about you.

126.speaker: Sazza
126.text: Oi! Don't leave yer pal Sazza behind! I can't follow yer fancy booyahg.
126.context: NodeContext: urgent - being escorted by the player and they were going to use a teleport which would have left her behind - booyagh is pronounced

152.speaker: Sazza
152.text: Door's open, I see. 'Elp me escape, an' I'll introduce ya to my tribe, all friendly-like.

154.speaker: Sazza
154.text: Bloody tiefs everywhere. We movin' or wot?

19.speaker: Player
19.text: In a moment. Stay here and keep out of the way.

72.speaker: Sazza
72.text: It ain't safe here. Hurry back.

101.speaker: Sazza
101.text: Sure fing. I'll 'ang back a little.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: We're moving. Keep close to me.

AD_TieflingLeader_1.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader_1.text: Why don't you just set me free, tiefy?

AD_TieflingLeader_10.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader_10.text: I'll tell you everything you want to know... I swear.
AD_TieflingLeader_10.context: NodeContext: she's messing with him. she won't tell him shit and they both know it. she's wheedling him.

AD_TieflingLeader_3.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader_3.text: And you ain't a good player.

AD_TieflingLeader_9.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader_9.text: Mind yer business. This ain't it.

AD_TieflingLeader_13.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingLeader_13.text: You'll soon find out how wrong you are.

AD_TieflingLeader_7.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader_7.text: The Absolute will save me. She'll burn this place to the ground!

AD_TieflingLeader_0.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingLeader_0.text: What do you know about the Absolute?

AD_TieflingLeader_2.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader_2.text: We chose each other, Her an' me.

AD_TieflingLeader_5.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader_5.text: I got the brand to prove it. What do you got?

AD_TieflingLeader_14.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader_14.text: I feel bad for ya. I do, really.

AD_TieflingLeader_12.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingLeader_12.text: You'll eat those words soon enough.

PAD_Healer_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Healer_0.text: A goblin healer? That's a new one. But she might be the only way to keep our skulls intact.

PAD_Healer_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Healer_1.text: She's worth talking to, at least.

AD_0.speaker: Sazza
AD_0.text: Let me out, ya bunch of softies!

AD_1.speaker: Sazza
AD_1.text: Yer gonna be sorry. Every last one of ya!

AD_3.speaker: Sazza
AD_3.text: You tiefs are all borin'! Even yer cages are borin'!

AD_5.speaker: Sazza
AD_5.text: Ah, feels good to be free.

AD_2.speaker: Sazza
AD_2.text: I'll repay ya for the favour, 'ave no doubt.

AD_6.speaker: Sazza
AD_6.text: I'm gonna bite the 'eads off yer kids. An' yer birdies. An' yer dogs!
AD_6.context: NodeContext: Smacks lips at end of line.

PAD_Freed_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed_0.text: That goblin is in my debt - should prove useful one day.

PAD_Freed_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed_1.text: Or it'll come back to haunt us.
PAD_Freed_1.context: NodeContext: Karlach: A little naive but sincere.
